intro: Rapanea rubens, commonly known as the red-leafed evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pentaphylacaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that turn reddish in color under certain environmental conditions. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
